body: LEAD: A Brooklyn man who was fatally shot by police officers Friday night after a six-mile chase on the Belt Parkway was unarmed, but the officers may have thought he had a weapon because of messages broadcast on the police radio, investigators said yesterday. body: LEAD: Every afternoon at 3 o'clock, a private patrol car begins rolling through one of the prettiest neighborhoods in Brooklyn. It cruises under canopies of ailanthus and maple trees, past unbroken rows of 19th-century brownstones, chocolate-rich and crisply preserved, with their jaunty window bays and welcoming stoops. body: LEAD: THE Department of Transportation is racing to meet a deadline for reopening the little Carroll Street Bridge across the Gowanus Canal in Brooklyn. The unusual 1889 retractile-type bridge - the oldest in the country - has been left open since 1986, but the department has been repairing it since last December and it should be working in time
title: STREETSCAPES: The Carroll Street Bridge; Getting a Landmark in Shape for Its 100th Birthday
